abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Kabul Aybak and
            Mazar-e-Sharif Power Project for Afghanistan were as
            follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was high, Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and
            Grantee performance was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: it is hard to avoid the impression that the
            project was seen as a means of adding funds to emergency
            power rehabilitation project (EPRP) for rehabilitation
            investments, based on needs identified, feasibility, and
            implementation arrangements prepared earlier. Yet a rigorous
            appraisal of the project on its own merits may have revealed
            its design shortcomings. The proposal to provide for an
            obligation of operation and maintenance of the
            infrastructure rehabilitated under the contracts did not
            prove effective because contractors demobilized and
            enforcement of legal remedies to complete works or correct
            defects now needs to be sought. In countries with a history
            of conflict and poor capacity, consideration should be given
            to relative or incremental indicators, for example the
            number of households connected and metered, and the project
            development objective (PDO) framed around these simpler and
            more easily measured metrics. Some flexibility in design is
            essential, including the early identification of alternative
            activities to finance. Similarly, the inability to travel on
            site should be considered at inception, including by
            exploring alternative options through modern technology. It
            is, important that coordination between Ministry of Energy
            and Water (MEW) and Da Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat (DABS) be
            considered together at project design, especially if it is
            known that further sector development is planned during the
            project's lifetime.
